content.webTitle: Merry Chrismukkah! Shall we throw a turkey on the barbie? | Open thread

fields.headline: Merry Chrismukkah! Shall we throw a turkey on the barbie?
fields.bodyText: At the very least it's a bank holiday, right? In modern Britain people can hopefully enjoy the festive season and Christmas Day regardless of their faith or nationality. Whether you're a mixed Jewish-Christian family celebrating Chrismukkah – as popularised by noughties teen soap the OC – an Australian living abroad and cooking your turkey on the barbecue, or an Anglo-Germanic family battling over which day is actually Christmas, we'd like to hear about your cross-cultural Christmas traditions.
